profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:16-0400

did.unittitle: A topographic memoir on East and West Florida, 1818
did.abstract: This memoir includes sections on East Florida's boundaries, physical characteristics, navigation, Indian customs, Spanish settlements, Negroes, agricultural products, and climate. Also included are itineraries for East and West Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A chapter of this memoir is devoted to Seminole and aboriginal inhabitants of Florida: names, numbers, settlements, war and treaties, councils, marriage, trade, amusement, etc.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Also found on this reel is Benjamin Hawkins' Journal of occurrences in the Creek agency from January to the conclusion of the conference and treaty at Fort Williamson, 1802 (Film 692a).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Hugh Young was an army officer.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in possession of Francis W. Rawle.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: Printed, Boyd (1934), Florida Historical Society Quarterly 13: 16-50, 82-104.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.

controlaccess.subject: African Americans--Florida
